values: The publisher finally revealed the cover they have designed for my book. I am non-plussed. I told them I wasn't impressed by it, and that I really didn't like it. They basically told me to (shut up and) write and not fuss about the cover design, because they "know what their doing." They also said that Barnes and Noble was impressed by the cover and are considering running a promotion of their own on the book when it releases in February. This is their cover design: This was my original cover design, by the by... Intrepid Magazine, though in it's infancy, is doing well. Still striving to increase subscriptions. Getting some phenomenal writers! Last month's coup was Walter Cruttenden of the Binary research institute. I saw him on a Discovery Channel documentary, 2012: Scientific or Superstitious? I contacted him and he send me a fascinating article on Ancient Cosmology for last month's issue. I just interviewed former Governor of Minnesota, Arne Carlson for this current issue. If all goes well, it will be out by the weekend. Not having a staff, sucks. LOL! If you haven't seen the mag, go download the free preview issue at the website - it's 74 pages of Politics, Science, UFOs, Unexplained Phenomena and Conspiracies from phenomenal writers all around the world. That;'s one thing my stint with TAPS and the Ghost Hunters gave me... incredible networking.

Other than one or two random posts, it's been years since I've used LJ. 

Anyone I know still out there...?
Hello...? *tap* *tap* Is this thing still on...?

You all rock, and I thank you very much.

Come stuff your faces on a spaghetti buffet, and help them reach their goal!!

Cheers!
~Scotty (Abby & Bryn's Dad)

Star Trek film names Kirk actor Little-known actor Chris Pine has been chosen to play the young Captain Kirk in the new Star Trek movie. Pine had to turn down a role opposite George Clooney in the film White Jazz in order to play Kirk because of a clash of filming schedules. Lord of the Rings actor Karl Urban will play Leonard "Bones" McCoy, the Starship Enterprise's medical officer. The film, which chronicles the early days of the Enterprise crew, will be released in the US on 25 December 2008. The movie will show the crew meeting at the Starfleet Academy and embarking on their first mission. The Paramount Pictures film is expected to begin shooting in November. Urban's character, Dr. Leonard "Bones" McCoy, was responsible for several of Star Trek's famous phrases including: "He's dead, Jim." New Zealand-born Karl Urban played Eomer in the Lord of the Rings trilogy. He also co-starred in The Bourne Supremacy. The new Trek film, directed by Lost creator JJ Abrams, is Star Trek's 11th big screen outing. The most recent Trek film, Star Trek: Nemesis, was released in 2003. NEW STAR TREK FILM CAST Captain Kirk - Chris Pine Older Mr Spock - Leonard Nimoy Young Mr Spock - Zachary Quinto Scotty - Simon Pegg (Shawn of the Dead) Nero - Eric Bana Uhura - Zoe Saldana Chekov - Anton Yelchin Sulu - John Cho Leonard 'Bones' McCoy - Karl Urban

Hey Folks! Some fun news, reposted from the MRF & MNRF listerves.... (for those of you at Fest, but not on either of those news forums) I have been asked if I would like to come out and promote my book, "The Rollicking Adventures of Tam O'Hare," by doing a little stage show. So, on SCOTTISH WEEKEND - August 25/26, and IRISH WEEKEND - September 8/9, I - and a cast of thousands - will be performing three to four shows daily at the Children's Realm Stage. Adding to the fun for me, are the PEOPLE WHO WILL BE JOINING ME on stage... John Neitz, Luis Rosa, Dave Potter, Don Preston, Abby & Bryn Roberts... and a bunch of other people, as of yet uncommitted tentatively or otherwise. There will be readings from the book, and reenacted scenes from the story - including a little swordplay. So if you have some time, and are inbetween grided shows, or just wandering by at the right moment, stop and watch for a few minutes. It'll be fun to see you all. Thanks again to Danielle. Cheers! ~Scotty p.s. If you haven't seen the book, yet, and are interested, just take a peek... Tam O'Hare has arrived!!!

The feeling is awesome.

The first box, freshly opened... about ten minutes ago.....

Hey Folks, Many of you know - and perhaps many do not - that my book has been published. The Rollicking Adventures of Tam O'Hare will release in a limited "Author's Edition" soft cover on May 16th, and the hard cover will release in mid-October, when you should be able to "find it in stores everywhere." I am the author and Illustrator of this children's picture book gone wildly cross-generational, morphing into a young reader's/adult (grown-up) novel with pictures. You can see some excerpts of the text, and many of the illustrations at the Tam O'Hare MySpace, or the official Tam O'Hare website. * * * HERE'S SOME EVENT NEWS: I will be making two local book promo appearances. IT'D BE GREAT If you could make it!! SATURDAY, MAY 19th, ALL DAY The Minnesota Scottish Fair & Highland Games I'll be at the Three Celts & Company booth/tent, signing books and posters. SATURDAY, MAY 26th, 2:00pm 'til 5:00pm Magus Books 1309 1/2 SE 4th St., (DinkyTown, U of M Campus) Minneapolis, MN 55414 I'll be signing books and posters. Hope to see you at one of these events! Cheers! ~Scotty p.s. Oh... and I'll also have a bunch of these 18" x 24" posters with me, as well...

Hey Folks!
My book goes to press next week!! You haven't seen much of me around here, of late, due to the time I've been spending getting this baby ready for publication, but it is looking as though we are finally nearing the end of the road - or would this better be called, the "beginning??"



You can NOW pre-order The Rollicking Adventures of Tam O'Hare, in advance of the release date of June 1st, 2007. The package I have put together for you is this:

1) Purchase the book now, prior to it's release date, and I will autograph the book for you (this sounds sooooo presumptuous... just keep in mind that most people out there ordering this book DON'T know me! LOL!). It will ship to you after June 1st, 2007

2) If you make this purchase and place your order NOW, you will also receive a FREE autographed 18"x26"Limited Edition wall poster - this poster (shown below) will not be available after June 1st, 2007,.

3) The cover price on the book is $16.95, plus an additional $3.00 for shipping and handling of the book and poster (shown below).

Go to my page and you will see a "BUY NOW" button in the right-side column. This will take you to a PayPal page where you can order the book either with your own PayPal account, or with a wide variety of credit cards.

Again, thank you everyone for your encouragement and support along the way... and thank you in advance for supporting my book.

Cheers!
~Scotty
Here's the latest... mom and four babies sleeping...

Moca started her labor around 6:30 this morning. So far we have three little girl puppies, as of 10:00am!! Two more to come!!


* * * * * UPDATED PHOTOS - as of 11:30am...

I have worked diligently over the last few years to prep my book for publishing. That effort has finally come to fruition with a major publishing contract for my book, The Rollicking Adventures of Tam O'Hare. I had to make a few sacrifices for saleability, but nothing that degrades the artistic integrity of the book. There will be a day when I can have every little detail of the deal just as I want it, but for now, as a first time author/illustrator, I am very happy with what has been offered.

I will have more details for you in the coming months, as to timing and availability. In the meantime, you can go read an excerpt from the book, and view some of the illustrations at my website by clicking on the picture below.

For those of you who have been my support and believed in this all along the way... thank you.

A thread of questions on which I'd like you all to ponder and give comment, if you'd like...

Does the inability to apply the "Scientific Method" to a thing, negate it's existence? Since God(s) (of any faith) is unquantifiable by current science, does that make that god/goddess mere fantasy... or does it simply mean that thing is simply unquantifiable by current scintific method? Is science and the application of scientific method the only meter by which a thing exsts?

For example, 1000 years ago, oxygen was an "unproveable" (hell, "undefineable") quantity. Since the science of that day could not apply the scientific methods of its limited scope, did that mean that oxygen was a thing of fantasy? Or was it merely a thing that was, at that time, undefineable and unquantifiable?

Has Science, elevated itself above Religion, taking on the role of "The New Religion?" Is Science the great usurper of Religion?

Does lack of quantifiable evidence prove that the unquantifiable element is fantasy?

What are your thoughts...?

Thanks, Orley...

Nice. and I could have sworn I was locked in bitter, anguished unrequittedness.... ;) This little quiz was sent to me by a friend... it is written and targeted, obviously, at and for women, but it works... ENJOY! (be wary of the request for your e-mail... could lead to tons of spam. I used a fake e-mail)... You are totally over your ex Your relationship with your ex was meaningful and you learned a lot from him or her, but you've already taken the steps necessary in moving on with your life. You may have mourned for a long time, and you may have been guilty of some not-so-smart post break-up behavior, but you are now ready to get past your old relationship hang-ups and look forward to new possibilities. Maybe it was a new potential partner that made the transition a little quicker for you or maybe you have decided to enrich your life by putting your energy and emotions into something more productive and fulfilling. Whatever your reason for being able to move on, you now feel confident in your decision to never persue that lying sack of shit ever again. Your tend to harbor little to no ill feelings, beyond the norm, and your faith in the possibility of a better, more fulfilling, honest relationship has been restored. You can look back on your relationship objectively, now that you have fully removed yourself from that horrid, life sucking little box, and look forward to life either as happily single or sharing new adventures with someone more honest and complimentary. Email this quiz to a friend

...and all I need to do is shamble down the stairs for a wee dram. Of course, that is only to uphold the pretense that I am a notorious drinker... ;) Last week, I completed the redesign of my basement, converting it into my very own 15th century-styled Tudor pub. I still have some furnishings I'd like to acquire, as well as the wood floors, but for now, it makes me feel really happy just sitting down there. I really want to thank my friends for helping me put this room together. most of all. And, of course, was in there troweling the plaster and rollering paint on the walls, as well as helping in all the details. What a great time and a fun project!! So... how about a little help naming my pub!! Anyone have any ideas...? * * * If you don't read my Myspace blog, here are a few pictures. If you're ever around, just stop on by.... and you who are my friends, know I mean that... The entryway at the bottom of the stairs...




The room....




A view from behind the bar....




More...




A bit of the detailing....




Amanda and friends enjoying the pub...




My friend Dan, and Amanda again...

You are The Star

Hope, expectation, Bright promises.

The Star is one of the great cards of faith, dreams realised

The Star is a card that looks to the future. It does not predict any immediate or powerful change, but it does predict hope and healing. This card suggests clarity of vision, spiritual insight. And, most importantly, that unexpected help will be coming, with water to quench your thirst, with a guiding light to the future. They might say you're a dreamer, but you're not the only one.

...what a woman means when she says she "can't find any good men." Fuck that nonsense. There are tons of good men out there. I have so many friends around me - not to mention drawing on my own experiences and past escapades - who are seeking "something better" than what they have or what they've had. So, in my reactionary lack of understanding, I have complied a short Top Ten list of what it seems women are actually seeking when they say "good men"..... 10) must not live in mom's basement (i.e.: must have his own place or place with sane roomies) 9) must have sane family and friends. 8) baggage free - lack of idiosyncratic behaviors (unlike most women seeking said male). 7) must not be needy (fuck... no comment). 6) must not have extra-cirricular friends, hobbies, sports or interests. 5) must not have a past of whoring or sleeping around (no comment). 4) must be a virgin (or damn near close) .... but with experience. 3) must be okay with her *need to be independent*, but emotionally and physically available when SHE needs him. 2) financial stabilty (unlike most women seeking said male). 1) must have six pack and be able to model in a Calvin Klein undies ad. Feel free to slap me up a bit, or add to the list....

Comment with your username and I'll give you an honest compliment. Then post this in your journal and spread the love (if you want).

This shouldn't be challenging at all, looking at MY friends list.

The first five people to respond to this post will get some form of art, by me.
It will be about, or tailored to, those five lucky "victims."

This offer does have some restrictions and limitations:
- I make no guarantees that you will agree with what I perceive as art and/or quality.
- What I create will be just for you.
- It'll be done before 30 days have passed.

You have no clue what it's gonna be. It may be story. It may be poetry. I may draw or paint or photograph something. I may bake you something. Who knows? Not you, that's for sure! I reserve the right to do something extremely strange.

The catch? Oh, the catch is that you have to put this in your journal as well!

Or not. I don't mind if you don't post to your journal.

Also- although the first 5 are guarenteed art, others are welcome to post a request for art. I may or may not get to it.
